awd_titl_txt: Engineering Research Equipment Grant: Instrumentation for   Analysis and High Bandwidth Motion Control of Computerized  Machines
awd_abstract_narration: This project supports the procurement of equipment needed to                    enhance research on mechanics and motion control problems of                    computerized electromechanical systems.  This instrumentation                   is an integral part of an experimental and theoretical                          research effort to study optimal control strategies to                          eliminate residual vibrations during point to point position                    control of motor driven flexible structures.  The                               instrumentation comprises a control analyzer, a digitizing                      oscilloscope, a waveform synthesizer, a power amplifier, a                      mini shaker, a DC supply/amplifier, a microcomputer, a data                     acquisition adaptor, and a plug in board.  The impact of the                    research is expected to be on the control of micro actuators                    in computer peripherals, robotic manipulators, space                            structures, and the active vibration damping of flexible                        structures.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
